TopicTitle: [0.21] Hooligan Labs - Airship, Submarines and More

Articles.Content:
I'd like to second the 'action group' request, sometimes I don't want every lifting envelope on the ship inflating.

Here are some 'eve ascent' pics:

ALL GLORY TO THE HYPNO-CIRRUS.

Here are some 'eve ascent' pics:

Cooooooooool.

I did start reworking the plugin a bit. I'll note the ability to prevent certain envelopes from inflating. No ETA.
The Party Starter has been updated on Kerbal Space Port. You can now drag the folder right in and it should work like a charm.
Edited June 2, 2013 by EvilMonkeyPaw

My Duna Base!

The first base I successfully landed on Duna, thanks for the suggestion to use the Cirrus, Hooligan, was able to land it on my first try after a small redesign.

Weigns roughly 10 tons and can relocate with the help of the RCS.

Some work in progress. I call it DERP -- Duna Explorer Reusable Prototype.

Gets better bang for the delta V than my usual 2-nuke lander, actually, now if I can also get it to mine kethane and land horizontally on Ike...
Hmm, the Cirrus might enable me to get that gi-normous spherical fuel tank that weighs 200 tons when full into orbit. The cirrus, good sir, is pure awesome.
Did SQUID not get an update? or am I doing something wrong.....

Some work in progress. I call it DERP -- Duna Explorer Reusable Prototype.
My Duna Base!

So much awesome! I love the designs, and that Duna is finally explorable with something decent looking.

Hmm, the Cirrus might enable me to get that gi-normous spherical fuel tank that weighs 200 tons when full into orbit. The cirrus, good sir, is pure awesome.

Technically it weighs nothing while in orbit. But let's see, you filled it while it was expanded you would have 8x the volume of a orange tank. Since I just found on the wiki that an orange tank weighs 36 tons full with 4 tons of that being steel, you could fit 256 tons of liquid fuel plus oxidizer in it. Total tonnage would be approximately... 256.4 tons? Since you would have something inside of it you wouldn't need to power the artificial muscle to hold the shape. Heck, you could program the plugin to have it shrink in size as fuel was spent.

Did SQUID not get an update? or am I doing something wrong.....

Updated it for you! Try it out. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/squid-paramagnetic-force-system/

Someone should make an airship hangar mod.

Still striving away on the plugin update. It looks like this right now.

That hovering hologram thing represents the vectors that I am working on. They are colored as follows:

Red - Center of Mass to Envelope Position

Green - Position Projected onto Ground Normal Plane

Blue - Control Vector (goal is to make it point up)

Magenta - Control Projected onto Ground Normal Plane

White - Gravity

My theory, in general, is that when everything is working right I will be able to take the dot product of the projected correction vector with the projected position vector and get the amount of additional buoyancy needed to stabilize each envelope.

There are some issues... vessel.transform.forward apparently points cockpit down! That will be easy to flip over. Also, the projected position vector does not seem to be working properly at all yet. But this is progress.
